author: Ella Lee
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James has appealed a court’s ruling that threw out a colossal penalty imposed upon President Trump and his business empire but kept her sprawling civil fraud case against him intact. Her office on Thursday filed a notice of appeal with New York’s highest court, signaling its intention to challenge a midlevel…
title: New York AG Letitia James appeals ruling that wiped colossal Trump penalty in civil fraud case

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. defended his tenure as the nation’s top health official during a contentious Senate hearing Thursday, snapping back at lawmakers who pressed him on recent upheaval at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and changes to vaccine policy.  During roughly three hours of testimony, the Health and Human Services (HHS) secretary…
title: Five takeaways as RFK Jr. battles GOP, Democratic senators on CDC, vaccines

author: Brett Samuels
description: White House officials rallied to the defense of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who faced an onslaught of criticism from Democratic senators and skepticism from some Republicans during a fiery hearing on Thursday. “Secretary @RobertKennedyJr is taking flak because he’s over the target,” White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt posted on…
title: White House defends Kennedy after fiery Senate hearing

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) said Thursday it would expand eligibility for catastrophic health insurance plans with new hardship exemption guidance. Applicants will be able to apply for catastrophic health coverage on Nov. 1, which will grant them access to lower monthly premiums and at least three primary care visits pre-deductible. “Catastrophic…
title: RFK Jr. says HHS expanding eligibility to catastrophic health insurance plans

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Adam Smith (D-Wash.) on Wednesday evening warned Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to not attend a Moscow summit floated by Russian President Vladimir Putin. “I’ll give a free piece of advice to President Zelensky: don’t go to Moscow. They don’t have your best interests at heart,” Smith, the ranking member of the House Armed Services…
title: Top House Democrat to Zelensky: ‘Don’t go to Moscow’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: USCIS will expand its law enforcement ranks by adding armed officers to investigate fraud and national security issues within the agency's jurisdiction.
title: Agency that issues visas, green cards forming police force

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: FBI agents raided former national security adviser John Bolton's home and seized multiple computers, phones, and documents related to his handling of classified information while writing his 2020 memoir.
title: Search warrant reveals what feds seized at John Bolton’s home

author: Robert Stilson, opinion contributor
description: The Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) has been criticized for its "hate map" and its wealth, which has more than doubled since 2016 and is now rivaling prominent universities and charities, despite its controversial and divisive activities.
title: The SPLC is biased — and extraordinarily wealthy

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: GOP Rep. Tim Burchett (Tenn.) got into a physical altercation with a protester on Thursday outside of the Longworth House Office Building.  The demonstrator approached Burchett with criticism on the handling of the war in Gaza and later bumped the lawmaker.  The Tennessee representative responded to being physically accosted by pushing the individual.  “Everyone has…
title: Tim Burchett and a protester get into a physical altercation on Capitol Hill

author: Julia Shapero
description: First lady Melania Trump hosted several top technology leaders at the White House on Thursday for a meeting of an artificial intelligence (AI) education task force, as she increasingly takes up the mantle of AI-related issues.  She was joined by Google CEO Sundar Pichai and IBM chairman and CEO Arvind Krishna, while OpenAI CEO Sam…
title: Melania Trump hosts tech leaders at AI education roundtable

author: Michael Zona, opinion contributor
description: President Trump's acting U.S. attorney in New Jersey, Alina Habba, is unable to be confirmed due to the blue slip tradition, which requires the consent of both New Jersey senators, Cory Booker and Andy Kim, and is a powerful tool that senators use to assert control over the federal law enforcement presence in their home state.
title: The Senate faces a reality check on blue slips

author: Mike Lillis
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said Thursday that Democrats are prepping to battle any GOP effort to minimize the severity of the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol. Jeffries said he’s in talks with Rep. Jamie Raskin (Md.), the senior Democrat on the House Judiciary Committee, about the party’s best approach to…
title: Jeffries says Democrats will fight GOP efforts to ‘whitewash’ Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol

author: Robert Greenway, opinion contributor
description: The Senate Foreign Affairs Committee has cleared Mike Waltz to become U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, and the full Senate must act quickly to confirm him before the U.N. General Assembly convenes on Sept. 10, as his unique combination of military and political experience makes him well-suited to address the challenges facing the U.N.
title: Confirm Mike Waltz as UN ambassador to implement Trump’s agenda

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Almost every Democratic member of the Senate Finance Committee called on Robert F. Kennedy Jr to step down as secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services following a major shakeup at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Eleven of the 12 Democratic Senators on the committee issued a statement Thursday demanding…
title: 11 of 12 Senate Finance Democrats demand RFK Jr resign

author: Rachel Frazin
description: A wind energy developer sued the Trump administration over its efforts to block a major project that would provide power to Rhode Island and Connecticut. Revolution Wind, which is a joint venture between Ørsted and a consortium led by Skyborn Renewables, sued over a stop work order the Trump administration issued. The developer said its project,…
title: Wind developer sues Trump over effort to block offshore project

author: Filip Timotija
description: The majority of Americans oppose President Trump sending federal troops into their areas to tackle crime, according to a new survey. The Economist/YouGov poll, published Thursday, found that 52 percent either strongly or somewhat oppose Trump potentially deploying National Guard troops into their home city to combat crime rates, while 39 percent either strongly or…
title: Majority opposes Trump sending federal troops into their area to combat crime: Survey

author: The Hill Staff
description: First lady Melania Trump on Thursday will host the second meeting of the White House Task Force on Artificial Intelligence Education, less than two months after President Trump unveiled his AI framework. The president in April signed an executive order that aims to incorporate AI into America’s classrooms.   “I predict AI will represent the…
title: Watch: Melania Trump leads White House AI task force meeting

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett has defended the court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade, stating that the court should not impose its own values on the American people and that the rights to marry, engage in sexual intimacy, use birth control and raise children are "fundamental".
title: Barrett: Supreme Court ‘should not be imposing its own values on the American people’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) said Thursday that she was “very concerned” about her party members’ lack of support for New York City mayoral nominee Zohran Mamdani.  “I am very concerned about the example that is being set by anybody in our party,” Ocasio-Cortez told reporters outside of the Capitol. “I believe that we must set…
title: Ocasio Cortez ‘very concerned’ about Democrats withholding Mamdani endorsement

author: Mazlum Özkan, opinion contributor
description: For decades, Iran relied on geography to preserve leverage over regional transit. With this corridor, that advantage has been eroded
title: Iran is the biggest loser in Trump’s Azerbaijan-Armenia peace deal

author: Amy Friedrich-Karnik and Megan Kavanaugh, opinion contributors
description: Access to affordable birth control is being chipped away through a series of incremental policy changes, legal rulings and funding restrictions that are quietly but effectively dismantling the reproductive health care safety net.
title: The right is waging a quiet war on contraception

author: Judy Kurtz
description: The longrunning feud between President Trump and Rosie O’Donnell is going strong — with the commander in chief threatening her American citizenship and the comedian predicting that survivors of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein will be part of Trump’s “reckoning.” “As previously mentioned, we are giving serious thought to taking away Rosie O’Donnell’s Citizenship,” Trump…
title: Rosie O’Donnell fires back after Trump reignites feud: ‘Epstein survivors are the reckoning’

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump’s deployment of Washington, D.C. National Guard troops to patrol the nation’s capital has been extended through December to ensure that service members receive the full scope of benefits for the mission, according to multiple news outlets.  The soldiers were placed in the district to aide in Trump’s federal takeover of local law enforcement,…
title: DC National Guard deployment extended through December: Reports

author: Ella Lee
description: The man accused of killing two Israeli Embassy staffers outside a Jewish museum in Washington earlier this year has pleaded not guilty to an array of criminal charges.   Elias Rodriguez, 31, faces nine counts, including murder of a foreign official and carrying out a hate crime resulting in death.   Federal prosecutors say he gunned down…
title: Man accused of killing Israeli Embassy staffers pleads not guilty

author: Tom Mockaitis, opinion contributor
description: The United Kingdom has not had a single school shooting since Dunblane.
title: Gun control ended school shootings in Britain. What’s America’s excuse?

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) will speak Thursday morning as lawmakers race to avert a government shutdown. Jeffries and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) have vowed a rocky battle if Democrats are left out of negotiations over any stopgap funding measure or long-term proposal. Lawmakers have until Sept. 30 to avoid a government funding lapse.…
title: Watch live: Jeffries gives remarks as lawmakers look to avert shutdown

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Former Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Susan Monarez, who was fired last week by the Trump administration, wrote Thursday that she was let go after refusing to give in to pressure to “compromise science itself.”  Monarez revealed details about her high-profile termination in a Thursday op-ed published in The Wall Street…
title: Fired CDC chief accuses RFK Jr. of ‘sabotage’ with vaccine moves

author: The Associated Press
description: He missed runway shows in June while recovering from an undisclosed illness.
title: Fashion designer Giorgio Armani dies

author: The Hill Staff
description: Health and Human (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is set to face tough questions on Capitol Hill Thursday as he testifies on President Trump’s health agenda, a week after chaos brewed at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) following a personnel overhaul. Kennedy shook up the agency last week after pushing out…
title: Live updates: Senate to grill RFK Jr. amid CDC chaos

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear (D), widely seen as a potential 2028 contender, has landed a deal with SiriusXM that will likely widen the reach of his podcast by tens of millions of listeners. SiriusXM announced on Thursday it will be airing “The Andy Beshear Podcast” across its podcast network and its Progress channel 127, a…
title: Beshear lands SiriusXM podcast deal amid 2028 speculation

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Emory University announced Wednesday it is ending all diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) efforts, pointing at the federal goverment. Interim President Leah Ward Sears in a message to the community said the closure is due to “federal law and mandates” and that leaders will “promptly and carefully to discontinue current DEI offices and programs.”  “We…
title: Emory University ending DEI efforts

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Job cuts have surged nearly 40 percent in August, with employers eliminating 85,979 positions, the largest August hit since 2020, likely linked to economic and market factors, as well as Trump's policies and the White House's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) cuts.
title: August job cuts highest since pandemic: Report

author: Eugene R. Fidell, William D. Baumgartner and Steven J. Lepper, opinion contributors
description: If the current path continues, our military will become less effective in defending us from external threats — and may become a tool of domestic coercion.
title: Trump and Hegseth want to turn the military into a tool of personal loyalty

author: Filip Timotija
description: Private employers added just 54,000 jobs in August, indicating a slowdown in the hiring market, according to ADP data released Thursday morning.  ADP’s jobs figure is lower than the forecast made by The Wall Street Journal, which predicted 75,000 positions added last month.  “The year started with strong job growth, but that momentum has been…
title: Just 54,000 jobs added in August: ADP

author: The Hill Staff
description: Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is testifying before the Senate on Thursday morning on the Trump administration’s health agenda. Kennedy is expected to face questioning over the recent shakeup of leadership at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) after he moved to fire former CDC director Susan Monarez…
title: Watch live: Kennedy testifies before Senate amid turmoil over CDC leadership changes

author: Julia Manchester
description: Larry Sabato’s Crystal Ball, a prominent election forecaster, moved its rating of Virginia’s gubernatorial race from “lean Democratic” to “likely Democratic.”  The rating change is good news for Democratic nominee and former Rep. Abigail Spanberger (D-Va.), who has consistently led Republican nominee and Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears (R ) in polling throughout the campaign.  Spanberger…
title: Virginia governor race moves to ‘likely Democratic,’ per Sabato’s Crystal Ball

description: Democrats should just rename themselves the “Not Trump” Party and be done with it.
title: Democrats can’t escape their toxic co-dependency with Trump

description: Recently released bodycam footage from Tallahassee police shows two officers arriving at the Chuck E. Cheese on July 23 to take Jones into custody.
title: Video shows Chuck E. Cheese mascot arrested on theft, fraud charges in Florida

description: Lisa Phillips, an accuser of the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, said it was “shocking and upsetting” for her to hear President Trump call their Capitol Hill push for transparency a “hoax” perpetrated by Democrats. “For me, personally, it was shocking and upsetting. I just — I couldn’t believe that he said that,” Phillips…

description: There is a growing risk of the world fracturing into rival geopolitical and economic blocs, threatening both prosperity and peace.

description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) repudiated his Republican colleagues on Wednesday for opposing his effort to force the Justice Department (DOJ) to publicly release information on the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. In remarks to CNN’s Manu Raju, the leader of the GOP rebellion warned his colleagues that they’re making a political mistake. “I care…

description: Cities across the country, in coordination with law enforcement, are already making progress against crime.
title: Mr. President, don’t undermine our cities’ progress on crime

author: Julia Shapero
description: Google scored a much-needed win Tuesday when a federal judge ruled the tech giant could hold on to its Chrome browser, rejecting the wide-ranging penalties proposed by the Department of Justice (DOJ).  The government had asked U.S. District Judge Amit Mehta to order Google to sell the browser, alongside numerous other remedies, after he found…
title: Google holds on to Chrome browser: What to know

author: Mark Toth and Jonathan Sweet, opinion contributor
description: Trump, to his great credit, finally appears to be seeing through Putin.
title: Ukraine has always had Trump’s back
